intro: Amsinckia tessellata var. macrosepala, commonly known as the giant leafed fennel, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its large, fern-like leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has a taproot system and thrives in well-drained soils, often found in arid and semi-arid environments. Its botanical features include hairy stems and serrated leaf margins, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It is valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes used in native plant gardens.
